column10: 0h/Controller will use Program Page(0x10) for NAND
column11: 1h/ Controller will use Program Page Cache(0x15) for NAND

column2: (SMI internal only) Detect Swap Time Out (sec)

column10: Indicate retry count to erase a block (0~15)

column2: Host Dram Cached data flush Idle time (ms)

column10: As the sum of Empty and Spare  SLC blocks are less than this field. the system will check whether the system idle time is longer than the assigned threshold

column2: Host idle time for background work start (ms)
column10: As the system idle time is longer than this field under the circumstance that the sum of Empty and Spare  SLC blocks are less than the assigned threshold. the system will enter clean mode
As the sum of Empty and Spare  SLC blocks are more than this field. the system will get ou of the clean mode
Indicates the company vendor assigned by the PCI SIG. This field is related to ID.VID
Indicates the device number assigned by the vendor. This field is related to ID.DID

column2: LTR L0 Entry - Max Snoop LatencyValue of ACTIVE LTR
column10: Along with the Max No-noop LatencyScale field. this register specifies the maximum no-snoop latency that a device is permitted to request. Software should set this to the platform's maximum supported latency or less.

column10: 1h/the component tolerates the removal of any reference clock(s) via the clock request (CLKREQ#) mechanism when the Link is in the L1 and L2/L3 Ready Link states.
column11: 0h/the component does not have this capability and that reference clock(s) must not be removed in these Link states.

column10: 1h/all namespaces shall be configured with the same attributes and a format of any namespace results in a format of all namespaces

column2: Format NVM Attributes (FNA) - Cryptographic erase per namespace
column10: 1h/A cryptographic(or user data) erase of a particular namespace as part of a format results in a cryptographic (or user data) erase of all namespaces.
column11: 0h/A cryptographic erase or user data erase as part of a format is performed on a per namespace basis.
